page.title: 20TRULY RURAL PERSON (cont)
page.content: Like pupils of 1985, she played with plasticine but instead of pencil and paper of today she used a slate and pencil. Desks used to be in tiers with very severe discipline; today desks are in small groups round which children are busily occupied and no belt is used for discipline. Children used to walk to school in large groups down the middle of the road but today taxis transports children along a now very busy road. One girl used to come to school on a pony! In the playground the Fife dialect was predominant but today English is heard in both the classroom and the playground. Singing games, chanting, marbles, rope and ball games were more popular in her childhood in the playground; marbles are used today from time to time but the playground, which slopes to a busy road, precludes ball games.
